docs.summary: Events that are fired by actions relating to site contacts.
description: Wix CRM events are fired on your site's backend when certain events occur related to site contacts.
You can write event handlers that react to these events. Event handler functions
receive data that corresponds to the event that fired. Use event handlers
to create custom responses to contact events.
To add a CRM event handler, add an **events.js** file to the **Backend** section
of your site if one does not already exist. All event handler functions for your
site are defined in this file.
Event handler functions are defined using the following pattern:
```javascript
export function <wixAppName>_<eventName>(event) { }
For example, an event handler that handles site visitor form submittal looks
like this:
```javascript
export function wixCrm_onFormSubmit(event) { }
Note that backend events don't work when previewing your site.

docs.summary: An event that triggers when a new workflow card is created.
description: The `onCardCreated()` event handler runs when a new [workflow](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-workflows)
card is created programmatically using the [`createCard()`](wix-crm-backend.Workflows.html#createCard)
function or manually in your site's Dashboard. The received `CardCreatedEvent`
object contains information about the card that was created.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event when a card is created
body: // Place this code in the events.js file

docs.summary: An event that triggers when a workflow card is moved.
description: The `onCardMoved()` event handler runs when a [workflow](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-workflows)
card is moved programmatically using the [`moveCard()`](wix-crm-backend.Workflows.html#moveCard)
function or manually in your site's Dashboard. The received `CardMovedEvent`
object contains information about the card that was moved.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event when a card is moved
body: // Place this code in the events.js file

docs.summary: An event that triggers when a workflow card is moved.
description: The `onCardRestored()` event handler runs when a [workflow](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-workflows)
card is restored programmatically using the [`restoreCard()`](wix-crm-backend.Workflows.html#restoreCard)
function or manually in your site's Dashboard. The received `CardRestoredEvent`
object contains information about the card that was restored.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

docs.summary: An event that triggers when a new contact is created.
description: The `onContactCreated()` event handler runs when a new
[contact](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-your-contact-list)
is created.
The received `ContactCreatedEvent` object
contains information about the contact that was created.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event fired when a contact is created
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.

docs.summary: An event that triggers when a contact is deleted.
description: The `onContactDeleted()` event handler runs when a
[contact](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-your-contact-list)
is deleted.
The received `ContactDeletedEvent` object
contains event metadata.
If a contact is deleted as part of a merge,
`metadata.originatedFrom` is sent as `"merge"`.
Otherwise, `originatedFrom` is omitted.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event fired when a contact is deleted
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.

examples.title: Ignore a delete event if it originated from a merge
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.
console.log('Contact was a source contact for a merge. Ignoring event.');

params.name: event
params.doc:
Information about the source and target contacts,
and metadata for the event.

docs.summary: An event that triggers when one or more source contacts are merged into a target contact.
description: The `onContactMerged()` event handler runs when a
[contact](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-your-contact-list)
is merged.
The received `ContactMergedEvent` object
contains event metadata.
Merging contacts triggers these events:
- `onContactMerged()` is triggered.
- [`onContactUpdated()`](#onContactUpdated) is triggered for the target contact. `metadata.originatedFrom` is sent as `"merge"`.
- [`onContactDeleted()`](#onContactDeleted) is triggered for each source contact. `metadata.originatedFrom` is sent as `"merge"`.
If you handle the originating merge event,
you can ignore update and delete events where `metadata.originatedFrom` is set to `"merge"`.
When `onContactUpdated()` and `onContactDeleted()` are not triggered from a merge,
`originatedFrom` is omitted from their event object.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event fired when contacts are merged
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.
console.log('Target contact updated by merge', targetContactId);
console.log('Source contacts deleted by merge', sourceContactIds);

params.name: event
params.doc:
Information about the contact that was updated
and metadata for the event.

docs.summary: An event that triggers when a contact is updated.
description: The `onContactUpdated()` event handler runs when a
[contact](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-your-contact-list)
is updated.
The received `ContactUpdatedEvent` object
contains information about the contact that was updated.
If a contact is updated as part of a merge,
`metadata.originatedFrom` is sent as `"merge"`.
Otherwise, `originatedFrom` is omitted.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event fired when a contact is updated
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.

examples.title: Ignore an update event if it originated from a merge
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.
console.log('Contact is a target contact for a merge. Ignoring event.');

docs.summary: An event that triggers when a site visitor submits a Wix Form.
description: The `onFormSubmit()` event handler runs when a site visitor submits a Wix Form (see the [`WixForms`](wix-crm.html#$w-wixforms) `$w` element).
The received `FormSubmitEvent` object contains information about the Wix Form that was submitted.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.
For Wix Forms client side events, see:
+ The [`onWixFormSubmit()`](wix-crm.html#$w-wixforms/onwixformsubmit) function, which sets events that fire when a site visitor submits a Wix Form yet before it is sent to the server.
+ The [`onWixFormSubmitted()`](wix-crm.html#$w-wixforms/onWixFormSubmitted) function, which sets events that fire when a site visitor submits a Wix Form and it is successfully received by the server.

+ The [`onWixFormSubmittedError()`](wix-crm.html#$w-wixforms/onWixFormSubmittedError) function, which sets events that fire when a site visitor submits a Wix Form and it is successfully received by the server.

members.name: workflowId
members.doc: ID of the workflow the card was restored to.

members.name: workflowName
members.doc: Name of the workflow the card was restored to.

members.name: phaseId
members.doc: ID of the phase the card was restored to.

members.name: phaseName
members.doc: Name of the phase the card was restored to.

members.name: data
members.doc: Information about the source and target contacts.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: Contact ID associated with the event.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, [GDPR](https://support.wix.com/en/article/gdpr-frequently-asked-questions)).
For advanced users.

docs.summary: An object representing a Wix Form.

examples.title: An event when a Wix Form is submitted
body: // Place this code in the events.js file

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID of the site visitor submitting the Wix Form.

members.name: submissionTime
members.doc: Date and time that the Wix Form was submitted.

members.name: submissionData
members.doc: Data submitted in the Wix Form. The object contains key:value pairs where the key is the field name and the value is the contents of the field.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: Contact ID associated with the event.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc:
If present and set to `"merge"`,
indicates the event was triggered by a merge.

See [`onContactMerged()`](#onContactMerged) for information on handling
merge events.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, [GDPR](https://support.wix.com/en/article/gdpr-frequently-asked-questions)).
For advanced users.
